importantArticles.headline: Chinese e-commerce juggernaut Alibaba Group Holdings (NYSE:BABA) restructured artificial intelligence (AI) assistant app Quark topped ByteDance’s Doubao to become China’s most popular AI app in March. Quark clocked close to 150 million monthly active users (MAUs) worldwide, followed by ByteDance’s Doubao and DeepSeek, which had almost 100 million and around 77 million users, respectively, SCMP reported Monday, citing Aicpb.com. Alibaba stock is trading higher on Monday. Also Read: Use AI Respons
importantArticles.title: Alibaba's Quark AI Surpasses ByteDance's Doubao With 150 Million Monthly Users

importantArticles.headline: The start of a new trading week was quite the boon for established Chinese tech stocks. Among these were Alibaba Group (NYSE: BABA), which notched a nearly 6% gain on the day.

importantArticles.headline: Big Chinese technology companies gained on Thursday as investors focused on the evidence that President Donald Trump is willing to negotiate tariffs.  Alibaba rose 1.2% in Hong Kong, Tencent gained 0.8% and Baidu climbed 2.4%.  Despite Trump raising the effective tariff on Chinese goods to 125%, traders seemed optimistic a deal might eventually be reached between the world’s two largest economies—despite the risks of further escalation.
importantArticles.title: Alibaba, Tencent Stocks Gain. Chinese Markets Ignore Trade War Risk for Now.

importantArticles.headline: (Bloomberg) -- As US stocks staged a chart-busting rally on Wednesday after President Donald Trump’s about-face in his trade policy, one group of investors had an especially sweet victory. Retail traders — who kept buying shares even when benchmark indexes tumbled and institutional investors fled — notched a 17% gain on Wednesday. That helped them nearly break even for the year, according to data from Emma Wu, JPMorgan Chase & Co.’s global quantitative and derivatives strategist. The S&P 500 Ind
